page.title: 14Cameley Hedgerow ii
page.content:
The hedge itself is a mixture of hawthorn(Crataegus monogyna),black- thorn(Prunus spinosa),hazel(Corylus avellana),some sycamore(Acer pseudoplatanus),some alder buckthorn (Frangula alnus),one purging buckthorn (Rhamnus catharticus),ash(Fraxinus excelsior),oak(Quercus robur),elder (Sambucus nigra),holly(Ilex aquifolium) and wild privet.
Away from the hedges in old meadowland can be found wild thyme(Thymus serpyllum),betony(Betonica officinalis),dyers greenwood(Genista tinctoria) and many species of thistle.
See also 'Cameley Hedgerow i'
